wiki_catalogs.name: System Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the smmm-system project. Explain its purpose as a full-stack solution for a tax consulting firm (SMMM) with integrated public website, admin dashboard, and client portal. Describe the core objectives: content management, client communication, job application tracking, quote requests, and role-based user access. Cover the technology stack including Next.js 16, React, TypeScript, Prisma ORM, NextAuth v5, Tailwind CSS, and Radix UI. Provide a high-level architectural overview of the App Router pattern, server and client components, and data flow from API routes to UI. Include deployment context, scalability considerations, and integration points such as PDF export and potential email services. Use diagrams to illustrate system context and component relationships. Make this accessible to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

wiki_catalogs.name: NextAuth Configuration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the NextAuth v5 configuration in smmm-system. Detail the setup in src/lib/auth.ts including the CredentialsProvider implementation, user authorization flow, and integration with Prisma via PrismaAdapter. Explain how the JWT session strategy is configured with custom callbacks to attach user role and ID to the token and session objects. Document the secret management using NEXTAUTH_SECRET environment variable and the signIn page redirection. Include code examples showing how the handlers are exported from [...nextauth]/route.ts and mapped to GET and POST methods. Address security aspects such as password hashing with bcryptjs and secure credential validation. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common configuration issues like adapter misconfiguration or callback execution order.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Models
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for all Prisma models in smmm-system. Detail each model including User, Client, JobApplication, QuoteRequest, ContactMessage, and all content entities (HeroSection, AboutSection, Service, PricingPlan, Testimonial, TeamMember, FAQ, etc.). For each model, document field types, constraints, default values, and business logic. Explain relationships between models with examples from the codebase, such as User to Client (one-to-one), User to Message (one-to-many), and FAQ to FAQCategory (many-to-one). Include entity relationship diagrams showing cardinality and foreign key constraints. Document enum types like Role, JobApplicationStatus, and QuoteStatus with their possible values and usage contexts. Address data validation rules enforced at the schema level and how they align with application business rules.

wiki_catalogs.name: Routing Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the Next.js App Router routing system in smmm-system. Explain the nested layout structure with root, public, admin, and client layouts, detailing how layout.tsx files enable shared UI elements while maintaining role-specific interfaces. Document the routing convention using folder-based routes and special route handlers in src/app/api/. Describe the authentication route handling with [...nextauth] dynamic segments and API route patterns for CRUD operations. Illustrate the request flow from URL to server component rendering, including server-side data fetching and client-side navigation with usePathname. Include security considerations for route protection and role-based access enforcement at the routing level. Provide diagrams showing the routing hierarchy and navigation flow between public, admin, and client sections.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the authentication endpoints in smmm-system. Document the NextAuth v5 API routes and their integration with the Prisma adapter. Explain the authentication flow, including sign-in, session management, and token handling. Detail the HTTP methods used, request/response schemas, and security considerations such as CSRF protection and JWT validation. Include examples of successful and failed authentication attempts, along with corresponding status codes and error messages. Describe how role-based access is enforced at the API level and how session data is persisted and retrieved. Provide implementation examples showing how frontend components interact with the auth API for login, logout, and session validation.

wiki_catalogs.name: Contact Messages
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the contact message management system in smmm-system. Explain the implementation of message submission from the public website, storage via Prisma ORM, and retrieval in the admin dashboard. Document the data model including fields such as name, email, phone, subject, message, status, and createdAt. Describe the admin interface for viewing, filtering by status, searching, and paginating messages. Detail the functionality of the view modal, status editing modal, and delete confirmation dialog. Include information on how status updates are handled via PATCH requests to the API, message deletion via DELETE requests, and PDF export using jsPDF in src/lib/pdf-export.ts. Provide code examples from the frontend components and API routes, explain error handling with toast notifications, and describe the integration between UI components and backend services. Address privacy considerations for personal data and compliance with KVKK regulations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Site Settings Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Site Settings sub-feature of the CMS. Thoroughly explain the implementation of the site-wide configuration interface, including organization name, contact information, social media links, and SEO settings. Document how the form integrates with the API route for persistence using PATCH requests. Include examples of Zod schema validation rules and React Hook Form integration for real-time input handling. Explain the state management pattern used to handle form submission and success/error feedback. Address common issues such as invalid URL formats and required field validation. Provide guidance on extending the site settings with additional fields and ensuring backward compatibility.

wiki_catalogs.name: PDF Export Utilities
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the PDF export functionality in pdf-export.ts. Explain how jsPDF is utilized to generate standardized PDF documents for contact messages, job applications, and quote requests. Document the structure of each export function (exportContactMessageToPDF, exportJobApplicationToPDF, exportQuoteRequestToPDF), including layout design, Turkish localization, status label translation, and dynamic page handling for long content. Provide code examples showing how these utilities are invoked from API routes or UI components. Detail the status label helper functions (getStatusLabel, getJobStatusLabel, getQuoteStatusLabel) that translate internal status enums to user-friendly Turkish text. Explain error handling, font sizing, line spacing, and document formatting best practices used in the implementation. Address performance considerations such as memory usage during PDF generation and client-side processing load. Include guidance on extending these templates with new sections or branding elements like logos while maintaining consistency.

wiki_catalogs.name: Tailwind CSS Configuration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the Tailwind CSS configuration in smmm-system. Explain the configuration structure as defined in tailwind.config.ts, including theme extensions, custom colors, spacing, and font definitions. Detail how the configuration integrates with the shadcn/ui component library through components.json, particularly focusing on the 'new-york' style preset and CSS variable usage. Document the role of the 'aliases' configuration in simplifying imports across the codebase. Include practical examples of extending the theme for new components while maintaining design consistency. Address common configuration issues such as missing utility classes or incorrect theme inheritance, and provide troubleshooting steps. Highlight performance considerations when customizing the Tailwind configuration.

wiki_catalogs.name: Admin Interface Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for Admin UI components in smmm-system. Explain the purpose and functionality of each content tab component used in the admin dashboard for managing website sections (Hero, About, Services, Pricing, etc.). Document the modal components for handling contact messages, job applications, and quote requests with editing capabilities. Describe the component architecture, props interface, form integration with React Hook Form and Zod validation, and data submission flow via API routes. Include usage examples from the admin content management pages. Address role-based visibility, form state management, and error handling patterns. Provide guidance on extending existing tabs or creating new ones following the container/presentation pattern.

wiki_catalogs.name: Core Entities
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for core business entities in smmm-system, including User, Client, Declaration, Collection, and Reminder. Detail each model's fields, constraints, default values, and business logic. Explain the one-to-one relationship between User and Client, where each client must have a corresponding user account. Document the Declaration model used for tax return tracking, including period formatting and PDF storage. Describe the Collection model for income/expense tracking with its decimal precision and type enumeration. Explain the Reminder model for scheduling follow-ups with completion status. Include examples from the codebase showing how these models interact in typical workflows, such as a Client creating a Declaration through their associated User. Address data validation rules at the schema level and how they enforce business requirements like unique tax numbers and email addresses.

wiki_catalogs.name: About Section API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the About Section content management endpoint in smmm-system. Document the HTTP methods (GET, PATCH) supported by this endpoint, including URL pattern (/api/content/about) and authentication requirements (admin role). Detail the request/response schemas, including the structure of the about content block with fields such as title, description, and image URL. Explain how the endpoint interacts with the Prisma database layer to retrieve and update about section data. Include examples of request payloads for updating the about content, along with sample responses and error cases. Document the use of Zod for request validation, error handling middleware, and role-based access control enforcement. Provide implementation examples showing how the Admin About Tab component consumes this API to enable dynamic content updates through the admin dashboard interface.

wiki_catalogs.name: Hero Section CRUD API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for the Hero Section CRUD endpoints in smmm-system. Detail the implementation of HTTP methods (GET, POST, PATCH, DELETE) in the /api/content/hero route. For GET, explain the retrieval of hero items sorted by sequence order. For POST, document the creation of new hero content blocks with fields like title, subtitle, call-to-action text, and order. For PATCH, detail the update mechanism using the 'id' query parameter and partial data updates, including validation and error handling. For DELETE, describe the soft/hard delete logic and response format. Include request/response examples, Zod validation usage (if applicable), and integration with Prisma ORM. Explain how this endpoint is consumed by the Admin Hero Section Tab component for managing hero content. Address error scenarios such as missing IDs, database failures, and authentication requirements. Provide code examples showing frontend invocation patterns using fetch or Axios.

wiki_catalogs.name: Institutions CRUD API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for the Institutions CRUD endpoint (/api/content/institutions) in smmm-system. Detail all HTTP methods: GET for retrieving institution list ordered by sequence, POST for creating new institutions, PATCH for updating existing institutions by ID, and DELETE for removing institutions by ID. Document the request/response schemas including fields like id, name, description, logo (Base64), url, isActive, and order. Explain the query parameter usage for ID in PATCH and DELETE operations. Detail the Prisma interactions with the clientLogo model, including error handling for missing IDs and database operation failures. Include Zod validation considerations, authentication requirements via NextAuth, and role-based access control (admin-only access). Provide code examples showing how the Admin Institutions Tab component uses fetch requests for each operation, including proper headers and payload formatting. Document error responses with status codes (400 for missing ID, 500 for server errors) and corresponding error messages in Turkish. Explain the integration with the frontend InstitutionsTab component for list rendering and form submissions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Getting Started
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on setting up the development environment for smmm-system. Provide step-by-step instructions for installing dependencies using npm or yarn, configuring environment variables (including database connection, authentication providers, and AWS SES if applicable), and running the application in development mode. Include guidance on initializing the Prisma database, applying migrations, and seeding initial data using prisma/seed.ts. Document common setup issues and their solutions, such as port conflicts, database connection errors, and authentication configuration problems. Explain how to access the public site, admin dashboard, and client portal with test credentials. Include commands for development, building, and starting in production. Make this beginner-friendly with clear, actionable steps.

wiki_catalogs.name: Role-Based Access Control
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the role-based access control system implemented in src/lib/auth.ts. Explain how user roles (admin, client) are extended into the NextAuth session through module augmentation in the declare module 'next-auth' block. Document how the role property is passed from the database through the authorize callback and attached to both the JWT token and session object via callbacks. Illustrate how this enables protected routing by showing examples of role checks in layout components or API routes. Include practical examples of how different roles receive different access levels within the application. Address common issues such as role persistence across sessions, type safety with TypeScript extensions, and debugging missing role information. Provide best practices for adding new roles or modifying access policies.

wiki_catalogs.name: Database Migrations
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the database migration workflow in smmm-system using Prisma Migrate. Explain how schema changes are tracked through migration files in the migrations directory, including the structure of migration.sql files and the migration_lock.toml file. Document the process of creating new migrations using 'prisma migrate dev' and applying them in production with 'prisma migrate deploy'. Provide examples of common migration scenarios such as adding new fields, modifying relationships, and altering constraints. Include best practices for migration naming, testing migrations in development, and handling migration failures. Address team collaboration considerations and how to resolve migration conflicts.

wiki_catalogs.name: Component Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the component architecture of smmm-system. Describe the organization of components into feature-based directories (admin, client, landing, dashboard) and the reusable UI library in src/components/ui. Explain the design system implementation using Radix UI primitives and Tailwind CSS. Detail the container/presentation pattern used in admin content tabs and landing page sections. Document the client component usage in interactive elements like dashboards and modals, and server component usage in static content sections. Include examples of component composition patterns, such as how landing page sections are assembled from individual components. Address accessibility implementation, responsive design patterns, and performance optimization through component lazy loading and code splitting.

wiki_catalogs.name: Contact Messages API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the contact messages endpoints in smmm-system. Document the CRUD operations available for managing contact messages, including HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, and authentication requirements. Explain how the API interacts with the Prisma ORM to persist and retrieve contact message data. Include detailed examples of request payloads for creating new messages and responses for listing, updating, and deleting messages. Document validation rules using Zod, error handling patterns, and status codes. Address security aspects such as input sanitization and role-based access control for admin users. Provide client implementation examples showing how the admin dashboard consumes this API to display and manage incoming contact messages.

wiki_catalogs.name: Quote Requests
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the quote request management system in smmm-system. Explain the workflow from public form submission to admin processing, including data persistence through Prisma and API interactions. Document the data model with fields like name, company, email, phone, serviceType, message, status, and createdAt. Describe the admin interface that supports filtering by status and service type, full-text search, and pagination. Detail the functionality of the view modal displaying request details, the edit status modal allowing state transitions, and the delete confirmation mechanism. Explain how PDF exports are generated using the shared exportQuoteRequestToPDF function in src/lib/pdf-export.ts. Provide concrete examples from the codebase showing API request handling, state management in the admin page, and event propagation between components. Cover error handling strategies, success notifications using Sonner, and performance considerations for large datasets. Highlight integration points with the public website and authentication system.

wiki_catalogs.name: Hero Section Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Hero Section management functionality. Explain the implementation of the hero content editor, including title, subtitle, description, button text, URL targeting (with section navigation or custom URLs), and image upload. Detail the integration with the reorder API endpoint that enables drag-and-drop ordering of hero items. Document the use of useEffect hooks for data fetching and state synchronization. Include examples of how the buttonUrl field dynamically updates based on selected navigation targets. Explain the form state management and submission process via PATCH/POST requests. Address common issues such as image upload failures and invalid URL routing. Provide optimization tips for rendering performance and accessibility considerations for the hero component on the public site.

wiki_catalogs.name: Helper Utilities
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the helper utilities in utils.ts. Focus on the cn() function that combines clsx and tailwind-merge to safely concatenate Tailwind CSS class names with proper merging of conflicting classes. Explain its role in the component library for dynamic className composition, especially in reusable UI components where styling needs to be extended or overridden. Provide practical examples from the codebase showing how cn() is used within components like buttons, cards, or modals to apply conditional styling and ensure design system consistency. Discuss the technical rationale behind using both clsx for conditional class evaluation and tailwind-merge for handling Tailwinds utility-first conflict resolution. Address common issues such as class ordering, specificity conflicts, and responsive utility overrides. Include usage patterns for theme-aware components and accessibility features. Document how this utility enhances developer experience and prevents common CSS bugs in the component tree.

wiki_catalogs.name: Global Styles and Theme Variables
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the global styling system defined in globals.css. Explain the use of CSS custom properties (variables) for theming, including light and dark mode color schemes using OKLCH color space. Document the structure of the :root and .dark selectors, and how they enable dynamic theme switching. Describe the implementation of responsive design through breakpoint definitions and base layer styling for universal element behavior. Explain the purpose of @custom-variant for dark mode and how it integrates with the theme provider. Provide examples of how global styles are applied to components and how new global utilities can be added. Address common issues like style conflicts, specificity problems, and performance impacts of global styles. Include best practices for maintaining global styles without introducing bloat.

wiki_catalogs.name: Client Portal Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Client Portal UI components in smmm-system. Focus on the client-logo-carousel component used in the client dashboard to display partner or institutional logos. Document its implementation using Tailwind CSS and the carousel utility from the UI library. Explain props for data input, responsive behavior across breakpoints, autoplay configuration, and navigation controls. Provide usage examples from the client dashboard page. Address accessibility considerations such as keyboard navigation and screen reader support. Include customization options for styling and integration with other dashboard components.

wiki_catalogs.name: Content Models
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for all content management models in smmm-system, including SiteSettings, HeroSection, ClientLogo, AboutSection, Service, WorkflowStep, PricingPlan, Testimonial, TeamMember, FAQCategory, and FAQ. For each model, document field types, constraints, default values, and editorial workflow implications (e.g., isActive flag for content visibility). Explain the hierarchical relationship between FAQCategory and FAQ, including slug-based routing. Describe the ordering system (order field) used for carousel and list sequencing across HeroSection, ClientLogo, and other ordered content. Detail media handling through Base64 fields for favicon, logos, and images. Include examples from the codebase showing how these models populate the public website sections. Address data validation rules that ensure content integrity, such as required titles and descriptions, and explain how the schema supports dynamic content updates without code changes.

wiki_catalogs.name: Hero Section API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for the Hero Section content management endpoints in smmm-system. Document both the main CRUD endpoint (/api/content/hero) and the specialized reorder endpoint (/api/content/hero/reorder). For the main endpoint, detail HTTP methods (GET, POST, PATCH, DELETE), request/response schemas for hero content blocks (including title, subtitle, call-to-action, and sequence order), and authentication requirements. For the reorder endpoint, explain the PATCH method implementation, payload structure for sequence updates (array of hero item IDs in desired order), and the transaction logic that updates all sequence numbers atomically. Detail how these endpoints interact with Prisma, including database queries and transaction handling. Include examples of request payloads for creating hero items and reordering them, along with sample responses. Document Zod validation schemas, error handling for invalid sequences, and role-based access control. Provide implementation examples showing how the Admin Hero Section Tab uses these APIs for content management and drag-and-drop reordering functionality.

wiki_catalogs.name: Hero Section Reorder API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed API documentation for the Hero Section reorder endpoint in smmm-system. Focus on the /api/content/hero/reorder POST route that enables drag-and-drop reordering of hero content blocks. Explain the request payload structure, which must include an array of objects containing 'id' and 'order' properties. Document the server-side implementation using Promise.all() to update each hero item's sequence number atomically. Discuss performance implications and potential race conditions, and how the current implementation handles them. Include sample request payloads demonstrating reordered sequences and expected success responses. Detail error handling for malformed payloads, invalid IDs, or database update failures. Explain how this endpoint integrates with the frontend drag-and-drop interface in the Admin Hero Section Tab, including state synchronization after reordering. Provide usage examples and best practices for calling this endpoint from the client side.

wiki_catalogs.name: Institutions Reorder API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed API documentation for the Institutions Reorder endpoint (/api/content/institutions/reorder) in smmm-system. Focus on the POST method implementation that handles sequence updates for multiple institutions atomically. Document the request payload structure requiring an array of objects with id and order properties. Explain the server-side logic using Promise.all() to update each institution's order field via Prisma, ensuring transactional consistency. Detail error handling for malformed payloads and database update failures, including appropriate 500 error responses with Turkish error messages. Describe the integration with the Admin Institutions Tab's drag-and-drop interface, where the onDragEnd event triggers this API to persist the new order. Provide a concrete example of the request payload showing 4-5 institutions with sequential order values. Explain how this endpoint works in conjunction with the main CRUD API to provide complete content management functionality. Document performance considerations for batch updates and potential improvements using Prisma transactions for enhanced data integrity.

wiki_catalogs.name: Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the Next.js App Router structure of smmm-system. Describe the layout system with nested layouts for public, admin, and client sections, explaining how layout.tsx files manage shared UI elements like navigation and theme. Detail the separation between Server Components and Client Components, highlighting usage patterns in the codebase. Explain the routing architecture with route handlers in src/app/api/ and their integration with Prisma and authentication. Document the component architecture including UI library in src/components/ui and feature-specific components. Include data flow diagrams showing request lifecycle from HTTP request to database and back. Address security boundaries, performance optimization through server-side rendering, and code organization principles applied throughout the project.

wiki_catalogs.name: Sign-In Process
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the sign-in process implemented in src/app/auth/signin/page.tsx. Describe the dual-tab interface allowing both admin (SMMM) and client (taxpayer) login with separate credential inputs. Explain the client-side form handling using React hooks like useState and useRouter for navigation after successful authentication. Document the password visibility toggle feature using Eye/EyeOff icons from lucide-react. Detail the toast notifications for success and error states using sonner. Include information about the development credentials section that displays mock login details for testing purposes. Explain the random background image selection from Unsplash for visual variety. Address how the form submission is handled per user type and where actual authentication would be integrated. Provide guidance on customizing the login UI, adding form validation, or integrating additional providers.

wiki_catalogs.name: Database Connection Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for database connection management in smmm-system. Explain the implementation in src/lib/db.ts and src/lib/prisma.ts, which are identical files providing a singleton instance of PrismaClient. Document how the globalForPrisma pattern prevents multiple instances in development hot-reloading environments. Explain the connection pooling behavior and how the client is reused across API routes. Address the performance implications of this pattern, including benefits for Vercel serverless functions and potential issues in long-running processes. Provide guidance on error handling for database connection failures and timeouts. Include code examples showing how to safely use the prisma client in API routes and server actions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Flow Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the data flow architecture in smmm-system. Map the complete data lifecycle from HTTP request in API routes to database persistence via Prisma ORM and back to frontend rendering. Explain the server-side data fetching patterns using async components and the separation between data-fetching logic in API routes versus client-side data synchronization. Document the authentication data flow with NextAuth, including session management and role-based data access. Illustrate how form submissions from client components flow through API endpoints to database operations. Include error handling patterns, loading states, and data validation using Zod in the data flow pipeline. Provide sequence diagrams showing typical data interactions for content updates, message submissions, and user authentication.

wiki_catalogs.name: Content Management API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the content management endpoints in smmm-system. Document each content section API (about, hero, institutions, site-settings) including their HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, and authentication requirements. Explain the CRUD operations implemented for each content type and how they interact with the Prisma database layer. Detail the special reorder endpoints for hero and institutions sections, including their payload structure and sequence update logic. Include examples of request payloads for creating and updating content blocks, along with sample responses. Document validation using Zod, error handling, and role-based access enforcement for admin users. Provide implementation examples showing how the admin content tabs interface consumes these APIs to manage website content dynamically.

wiki_catalogs.name: Job Applications
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the job application management system in smmm-system. Explain the end-to-end flow from public career form submission to admin review and processing. Document the data model including personal information, position applied for, experience level, CV file reference, message, status, and timestamps. Describe the admin interface with filtering capabilities, search functionality, and responsive table layout. Detail the implementation of the view modal that displays application details and CV download link, the status update modal for tracking progress, and the deletion workflow with confirmation. Explain how job application data is fetched via API routes and rendered using reusable table and modal components. Cover the PDF export functionality through src/lib/pdf-export.ts, including formatting of application data. Provide code examples from both frontend and backend, discuss error handling and user feedback mechanisms, and address data privacy for sensitive applicant information. Explain integration with the overall communication system architecture.

wiki_catalogs.name: Institutions Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Institutions (Clients) management sub-feature. Explain how administrators can add, edit, and reorder institutional logos displayed in the client carousel on the landing page. Document the implementation of the drag-and-drop reordering functionality powered by the reorder API endpoint. Detail the form interface for uploading institution logos, setting names, and managing visibility. Include examples of how the institutions data is structured in the database and consumed by the ClientLogoCarousel component. Explain validation rules for image dimensions and file types. Address common issues such as failed uploads and incorrect display order. Provide guidance on optimizing image assets for web performance and ensuring responsive behavior across devices.

wiki_catalogs.name: Component Styling Strategy
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the component-level styling approach in smmm-system. Explain how UI components in src/components/ui use Tailwind utility classes for styling, following the shadcn/ui design system principles. Document the role of components.json in configuring component aliases and ensuring consistent import paths. Describe how component variants (e.g., button sizes, card layouts) are implemented using utility classes and conditional className logic. Explain the integration between Radix UI primitives and Tailwind styling. Provide examples from actual components like button.tsx, card.tsx, and table.tsx to illustrate styling patterns. Address accessibility considerations in visual design, including focus states, contrast ratios, and screen reader support. Include guidelines for creating new components that adhere to the established design language and how to customize existing components without breaking consistency.

wiki_catalogs.name: Dashboard Layout Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for Dashboard Layout components used across admin and client interfaces. Detail the navbar component's role in navigation, role-based menu item rendering, responsive hamburger menu on mobile, and integration with authentication state. Document the breadcrumb component's dynamic path generation based on route hierarchy, accessibility markup, and styling via Tailwind CSS. Explain how these components are composed within layout.tsx files for admin and client sections. Include implementation details such as active link detection, hover states, and dark mode compatibility. Provide examples of integrating new routes into the navigation structure.

wiki_catalogs.name: Communication Models
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for communication and messaging models in smmm-system, including Message, Announcement, AnnouncementClient, ContactMessage, JobApplication, and QuoteRequest. Detail each model's fields, status enumerations (JobApplicationStatus, QuoteStatus, ContactMessageStatus), and lifecycle tracking. Explain the one-to-many relationship between User and Message for client-admin communication. Document the Announcement system with its broadcast (targetAll) and individual client targeting via AnnouncementClient join table. Describe the file handling in JobApplication (cvFileData as Base64) and its MIME type tracking. Explain how ContactMessage, QuoteRequest, and JobApplication serve as lead generation and customer intake mechanisms. Include examples from the codebase showing status transitions and notification workflows. Address data validation rules that ensure message integrity and compliance requirements for storing personal data.

wiki_catalogs.name: Institutions Section API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for the Institutions Section content management endpoints in smmm-system. Document both the main CRUD endpoint (/api/content/institutions) and the specialized reorder endpoint (/api/content/institutions/reorder). For the main endpoint, detail HTTP methods (GET, POST, PATCH, DELETE), request/response schemas for institution items (including name, logo URL, website, and sequence order), and authentication requirements. For the reorder endpoint, explain the PATCH method implementation, payload structure for sequence updates (array of institution IDs in desired order), and the transaction logic that updates all sequence numbers atomically. Detail how these endpoints interact with Prisma, including database queries and transaction handling. Include examples of request payloads for adding new institutions and reordering them, along with sample responses. Document Zod validation schemas (including URL validation), error handling for invalid sequences, and role-based access control. Provide implementation examples showing how the Admin Institutions Tab uses these APIs for managing partner institution logos and their display order.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication and Authorization
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the NextAuth v5 implementation in smmm-system. Explain the configuration in [...nextauth]/route.ts, including providers, callbacks, and session management. Detail the role-based access control system implemented in src/lib/auth.ts, showing how user roles (admin, client) are stored in the database and enforced throughout the application. Document the sign-in process, session persistence, and protected route patterns. Include code examples of authentication guards used in admin and client layouts. Explain how the Prisma adapter integrates with NextAuth and manages user records. Address security considerations like CSRF protection, secure session storage, and password hashing with bcryptjs. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common authentication issues.

wiki_catalogs.name: Session Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the session management system in smmm-system using NextAuth's JWT strategy. Explain how sessions are created, maintained, and destroyed across application routes. Detail the session callback in src/lib/auth.ts that enriches the default session with user ID and role from the JWT token. Discuss the implications of using JWT-based sessions including statelessness, scalability, and token expiration. Document how session data is securely stored in the browser and transmitted with requests. Include examples of accessing session data in server components using the auth() function and in client components via useSession(). Address common issues such as session expiration handling, concurrent session management, and clearing session state on sign out. Provide performance considerations and security best practices for session handling.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Seeding
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the data seeding process in smmm-system. Explain the implementation in prisma/seed.ts, including how it uses PrismaClient to upsert users (admin and clients) and create sample data for job applications, quote requests, and contact messages. Document the use of bcryptjs for password hashing and the creation of related records through nested writes (e.g., user with client). Provide examples of the seeding logic for different entity types and explain the purpose of using upsert operations. Include instructions for running the seed script and integrating it into the development workflow. Address security considerations such as using default passwords in development and how to extend the seed script for additional test data.

wiki_catalogs.name: Security Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the security architecture of smmm-system. Detail the authentication implementation using NextAuth v5 with custom session handling and role-based access control. Explain the middleware pattern for route protection and the security boundaries between public, admin, and client interfaces. Document the session management strategy, including token handling, expiration, and secure storage. Describe the authorization logic that enforces role-based access to different application sections and API endpoints. Include security measures such as input validation with Zod, protection against XSS and CSRF attacks, and secure API endpoint design. Address password hashing with bcryptjs and secure logout implementation. Provide threat models and mitigation strategies for common web application vulnerabilities.

wiki_catalogs.name: Job Applications API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the job applications endpoints in smmm-system. Document the HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, and authentication requirements for managing job applications. Explain the CRUD operations implemented in the route handler and how they interact with the Prisma ORM to store and retrieve job application data. Include detailed examples of request payloads (including file uploads if applicable) and responses for listing, viewing, updating, and deleting applications. Document validation rules using Zod, error handling patterns, and status codes. Address security considerations such as file type validation, input sanitization, and role-based access control for admin users. Provide client implementation examples showing how the admin dashboard consumes this API to process job applications.

wiki_catalogs.name: About Section Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the About Section management functionality. Explain the implementation of the rich content editor for the About section, including support for title, description, and image upload. Document how the component fetches existing data on mount and handles form submission via PATCH requests to persist changes. Include examples of how the content is rendered on the public landing page through the AboutSection component. Explain the integration between the admin form and the API route, including error handling for failed updates. Address common issues such as image format compatibility and text truncation in the frontend display. Provide best practices for writing compelling about content and maintaining brand consistency.

wiki_catalogs.name: Theme Management and Dark Mode
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the theme management system in smmm-system. Describe how the ThemeProvider component wraps next-themes to enable client-side theme switching between light and dark modes. Explain the integration between the React context provider, CSS variables in globals.css, and the browser's preferred color scheme. Document the data flow when a user toggles themes, including state management and DOM updates. Detail how theme persistence works across sessions using localStorage or cookies. Provide examples of consuming the theme context in components to conditionally render content or adjust styling. Address common issues such as flash of incorrect theme (FOUT), handling theme changes during server-side rendering, and ensuring smooth transitions between modes. Include performance optimization tips and accessibility considerations for users with visual preferences.

wiki_catalogs.name: Landing Page Sections
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Document the Landing Page Section components that constitute the public-facing website of smmm-system. For each section (Hero, Services, Pricing, Team, Testimonials, FAQ, Contact, Institutions, Workflow, Footer), describe its visual layout, content structure, and interaction patterns. Explain how data is fetched from the CMS via API routes and rendered dynamically. Detail responsive design implementations, animation effects, and accessibility features. Include guidance on content authoring through the admin interface and how changes propagate to these components. Provide examples of component composition on the public page.tsx and best practices for maintaining consistent design language across sections.

wiki_catalogs.name: Site Settings API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the Site Settings content management endpoint in smmm-system. Document the HTTP methods (GET, PATCH) supported by this endpoint, including URL pattern (/api/content/site-settings) and authentication requirements (admin role). Detail the request/response schemas, including the structure of site-wide configuration settings such as site title, meta description, contact email, phone number, address, social media URLs, and favicon settings. Explain how the endpoint interacts with the Prisma database layer to retrieve and update global site configuration. Include examples of request payloads for updating various site settings, along with sample responses and error cases. Document the use of Zod for comprehensive request validation (including URL and email format validation), error handling, and role-based access control enforcement. Provide implementation examples showing how the Admin Site Settings Tab component consumes this API to allow administrators to configure global site properties through a unified interface.

wiki_catalogs.name: Database and ORM
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the Prisma ORM implementation in smmm-system. Detail all data models including User, ContactMessage, JobApplication, QuoteRequest, and content entities (Hero, About, Services, etc.), explaining their fields, relationships, and constraints. Document the migration workflow and how schema changes are managed in production. Explain the database connection management in src/lib/db.ts and Prisma client instantiation in src/lib/prisma.ts. Include the data seeding process and sample data structure. Provide schema diagrams showing entity relationships. Address performance considerations like indexing strategies, query optimization, and connection pooling. Document data validation rules and business logic enforced at the database level.

wiki_catalogs.name: Profile API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the profile endpoints in smmm-system. Document the HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, and authentication requirements for user profile management. Explain the operations available for retrieving and updating user profile information, including how the API enforces ownership and role-based access control. Detail the interaction between the API and the Prisma database layer for user data persistence. Include examples of request payloads for profile updates and responses containing user data. Document validation using Zod, error handling, and security considerations such as preventing privilege escalation. Provide implementation examples showing how both admin and client interfaces consume this API to manage user profiles.

wiki_catalogs.name: Services Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Services management sub-feature. Explain how administrators can manage the list of services offered by the tax consulting firm, including service title, description, icon selection, and ordering. Document the form interface for adding and editing service items, including validation rules and submission handling. Detail how the services data is structured in the database and consumed by the ServicesSection component on the public website. Include examples of how icons are managed and displayed consistently across the UI. Address common issues such as missing icons or inconsistent service descriptions. Provide guidance on maintaining a clear and compelling service catalog that aligns with business offerings.

wiki_catalogs.name: Modal Dialogs
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for Modal Dialog components used throughout the application. Cover both functional modals (quote-request-modal) and informational/legal modals (KVKK, privacy policy, terms, career). Explain the implementation using Radix UI's Dialog primitive, accessibility standards (focus trapping, ARIA roles), and responsive behavior. Document the integration with global state for visibility control, animation transitions, and click-outside dismissal. For form-based modals, detail the connection to React Hook Form and submission handling via API routes. Include usage patterns from public and admin interfaces, and provide guidelines for creating new modals following existing conventions.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Endpoints
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for all endpoints in the smmm-system. For each API group (auth, contact-messages, content, job-applications, profile, quote-requests), document HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, and authentication requirements. Explain the CRUD operations implemented in each route.ts file and their interaction with Prisma. Include detailed examples of request payloads and responses for creating, reading, updating, and deleting resources. Document error handling patterns, status codes, and validation using Zod. Address security aspects like input sanitization, rate limiting considerations, and role-based access enforcement in API routes. Provide client implementation examples showing how frontend components consume these APIs.

wiki_catalogs.name: Quote Requests API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the quote requests endpoints in smmm-system. Document the HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, and authentication requirements for managing quote requests. Explain the CRUD operations implemented in the route handler and how they interact with the Prisma ORM to store and retrieve quote request data. Include detailed examples of request payloads for creating new quote requests and responses for listing, viewing, updating, and deleting requests. Document validation rules using Zod, error handling patterns, and status codes. Address security aspects such as input sanitization and role-based access control for admin users. Provide client implementation examples showing how both public forms and the admin dashboard consume this API to handle quote request workflows.

wiki_catalogs.name: Workflow Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Workflow Section management functionality. Explain the implementation of the workflow step editor, allowing administrators to define the consulting process stages with title, description, and icon. Document the data structure for workflow steps and how they are stored and retrieved via API endpoints. Include examples of how the workflow is rendered as a step-by-step visualization on the public landing page. Explain form validation and submission patterns used in the admin interface. Address common issues such as incomplete workflow definitions or inconsistent step ordering. Provide best practices for presenting the service workflow clearly to potential clients and aligning it with actual business processes.

wiki_catalogs.name: UI Component Library
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop comprehensive documentation for the UI Component Library based on Radix UI and Tailwind CSS. For each primitive (Button, Card, Form, Table, Tabs, Dialog, etc.), document its purpose, props interface, styling customization through Tailwind classes, and accessibility features. Explain the wrapper pattern used to enhance Radix UI components with project-specific defaults and styling. Detail form components' integration with React Hook Form and Zod validation. Include usage examples from various pages and modals. Address theming consistency, dark mode support, and responsive behavior. Provide guidelines for consuming these components in new features and extending them while maintaining design system integrity.

wiki_catalogs.name: Content Management System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the CMS functionality in smmm-system. Explain how administrators can manage all website content through the admin dashboard, including site settings, hero section, institutions, about section, services, workflow, pricing, testimonials, team, and FAQ. Detail the implementation of the content-tabs components and their integration with API routes for data persistence. Document the reordering functionality for hero and institutions sections. Explain the form validation using Zod and React Hook Form in content editors. Include usage patterns for uploading and managing media assets. Address content versioning considerations and publishing workflows. Provide guidance on extending the CMS with new content types.

wiki_catalogs.name: Pricing Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Pricing Section management sub-feature. Explain how administrators can configure pricing plans including plan name, price, features list, and call-to-action settings. Document the form interface for managing multiple pricing tiers and how changes are persisted through API routes. Include examples of how pricing data is rendered in the PricingSection component on the public website. Explain validation rules for numeric pricing values and required fields. Address common issues such as incorrect price formatting or missing plan features. Provide guidance on creating competitive and transparent pricing structures that convert visitors into clients.

wiki_catalogs.name: Utility and Global Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for Utility and Global Components that enhance the application's functionality and user experience. Explain the theme-provider's role in managing dark/light mode via context and localStorage persistence. Document the scroll-to-top component's visibility logic based on scroll position and smooth scrolling behavior. Describe the dynamic-favicon component's ability to change favicon based on theme or state. Detail the dom-error-boundary's error isolation and fallback UI strategy for component-level crashes. Include implementation details using React context, useEffect hooks, and DOM event listeners. Provide integration guidance for these components in layout files and their impact on overall application stability and UX.

wiki_catalogs.name: Communication Features
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed content for the communication management system in smmm-system. Explain the implementation of contact message handling, quote request processing, and job application management. Document the data models for each communication type and their lifecycle from submission to resolution. Describe the admin interface for reviewing, filtering, and responding to communications. Include details on status tracking, notification patterns, and data export functionality (PDF generation). Explain the integration between form submissions on the public site and the admin dashboard. Address privacy considerations for handling personal data and compliance with regulations like KVKK. Provide examples of common workflows and edge cases.

wiki_catalogs.name: Testimonials Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Testimonials management functionality. Explain how administrators can add, edit, and manage client testimonials including client name, position, company, quote, and avatar image. Document the form interface and image upload process for testimonials. Include examples of how testimonials are displayed in a carousel format on the public website via the TestimonialsSection component. Explain data validation rules and submission handling through API endpoints. Address common issues such as inappropriate content or low-quality images. Provide best practices for selecting and presenting authentic testimonials that build trust with potential clients.

wiki_catalogs.name: User Interfaces
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the UI component system in smmm-system. Describe the organization of components by feature area (admin, client, landing, modals, ui). Explain the design system based on Tailwind CSS and Radix UI primitives in src/components/ui. Document the implementation of key components like navigation bars, modals, forms, tables, and carousels. Include usage guidelines for each component, their props, events, and customization options. Address responsive design patterns and accessibility compliance. Provide examples of component composition in pages like the landing page and admin dashboard. Explain the theming system and dark mode implementation through theme-provider.tsx. Include guidance on creating new components following existing patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Team Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Team Section management sub-feature. Explain how administrators can manage team member profiles including name, title, bio, social media links, and profile images. Document the form interface for adding and editing team members, with support for multiple social platforms. Include examples of how team data is structured and consumed by the TeamSection component on the public site. Explain image upload requirements and validation rules. Address common issues such as broken social links or inconsistent team member information. Provide guidance on presenting the team in a professional manner that highlights expertise and builds client confidence.

wiki_catalogs.name: Utility Functions
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the utility functions in smmm-system. Detail the PDF export functionality in pdf-export.ts, explaining how it generates PDF documents for communications and applications using jsPDF. Document the helper functions in utils.ts including formatters, validators, and data processing utilities. Explain the integration of these utilities across the application, particularly in API routes and UI components. Include examples of how to use these functions in new features. Address performance considerations for PDF generation and memory usage. Provide guidance on extending the utility library with new functions while maintaining code quality and type safety.

wiki_catalogs.name: FAQ Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the FAQ management functionality. Explain how administrators can create, edit, and organize frequently asked questions with question and answer fields. Document the form interface for managing FAQ entries and how they are stored and retrieved via API routes. Include examples of how FAQs are rendered in an expandable/collapsible format on the public website through the FAQSection component. Explain validation rules for required fields and character limits. Address common issues such as duplicate questions or unclear answers. Provide best practices for anticipating client questions and creating helpful, concise responses that reduce support inquiries.

wiki_catalogs.name: Styling and Design System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the styling architecture of smmm-system. Explain the Tailwind CSS configuration in tailwind.config.ts, including theme extensions, plugins, and customizations. Describe the global styles defined in globals.css and their impact on the overall design. Document the component styling approach using utility classes and how components.json integrates with the UI library. Explain the responsive design strategy and breakpoints implementation. Address dark mode support and theme switching through the theme-provider. Include guidelines for maintaining design consistency across the public site, admin dashboard, and client portal. Provide examples of creating new styles while adhering to the established design system.

wiki_overview.content:
<blog>
# Comprehensive Project Analysis: SMMS System

## 1. Project Introduction

### Purpose Statement
The SMMS System is a comprehensive web application designed for a tax consulting and accounting firm (SMMM). The platform serves as a digital interface for client engagement, job application management, quote requests, and content administration.

### Core Goals and Objectives
- Provide a public-facing website for service promotion and client acquisition
- Enable administrative management of client communications, job applications, and service quotes
- Facilitate user authentication and role-based access control (Admin/Client)
- Offer a content management system for website sections including hero, services, pricing, team, and testimonials

### Target Audience
- **Administrators**: Internal staff managing client communications, job applications, and website content
- **Clients**: Businesses and individuals seeking accounting, tax, and auditing services
- **Job Applicants**: Professionals applying for positions at the accounting firm

## 2. Technical Architecture

### Component Breakdown
The application follows a Next.js App Router architecture with a clear separation between public, admin, and client interfaces. The system leverages Prisma ORM for database operations and NextAuth for authentication.

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[Client Browser] --> B[Next.js Application]
    B --> C[API Routes]
    C --> D[Business Logic]
    D --> E[Prisma ORM]
    E --> F[(PostgreSQL Database)]
    C --> G[Authentication]
    G --> H[NextAuth]
    H --> I[Prisma Adapter]
```

### Design Patterns
- **Component-Based Architecture**: UI components are organized by feature area (admin, client, landing)
- **Single Responsibility Principle**: Each API route handles specific resource operations
- **Global State Management**: Theme and UI state managed through context providers
- **Security Pattern**: Role-based access control implemented across application routes

### System Relationships
```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Public Website] --> B[Admin Dashboard]
    A --> C[Client Portal]
    B --> D[Content Management]
    B --> E[Message Management]
    B --> F[Application Management]
    C --> G[Profile Management]
    D --> H[Database]
    E --> H
    F --> H
    G --> H
    H --> I[Prisma ORM]
    I --> J[Next.js API Routes]
```

## 3. Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points
- **Public Interface**: `src/app/(public)/page.tsx`
- **Admin Dashboard**: `src/app/admin/page.tsx`
- **Client Portal**: `src/app/client/page.tsx`
- **Authentication**: `src/app/auth/signin/page.tsx`

### Core Modules
- **Database Access**: `src/lib/db.ts` and `src/lib/prisma.ts`
- **Authentication**: `src/lib/auth.ts`
- **API Routes**: `src/app/api/`
- **UI Components**: `src/components/`

### Configuration Approach
- **Next.js Configuration**: `next.config.ts` - configures image optimization and remote patterns
- **Database Configuration**: Prisma schema and migrations in `prisma/` directory
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS with component library integration
- **Environment Management**: Configuration through Next.js environment variables

### External Dependencies
- **Next.js 16**: React framework for server-side rendering and routing
- **NextAuth v5**: Authentication solution with Prisma adapter
- **Prisma ORM**: Database access and schema management
- **Tailwind CSS**: Utility-first CSS framework
- **Radix UI**: Accessible UI primitives
- **Zod**: Schema validation
- **React Hook Form**: Form state management

### Integration Points
- **Authentication Integration**: `src/app/api/auth/[...nextauth]/route.ts`
- **Database Integration**: `src/lib/db.ts` and `src/lib/prisma.ts`
- **Email Integration**: Nodemailer for contact and quote request notifications
- **PDF Generation**: jsPDF for document export functionality

```mermaid
graph LR
    A[Frontend Components] --> B[API Routes]
    B --> C[Business Logic]
    C --> D[Prisma Client]
    D --> E[Database]
    C --> F[External Services]
    F --> G[Email Service]
    F --> H[PDF Generation]
    I[Authentication] --> J[Protected Routes]
    J --> A
```

## 4. Key Features

### Functionality Overview
- **Public Website**: Landing pages with service information, testimonials, and contact forms
- **Admin Dashboard**: Comprehensive management interface for all system entities
- **Client Portal**: Personal profile management for registered clients
- **Content Management**: Admin interface for updating website content sections
- **Application Tracking**: Job application management with status tracking
- **Quote Management**: Service quote request handling and tracking

### Implementation Highlights
- **Role-Based Access Control**: Implemented across the application with protected routes
- **Form Management**: React Hook Form with Zod validation for all data entry
- **Responsive Design**: Mobile-first approach using Tailwind CSS
- **Image Optimization**: Next.js image component with remote pattern configuration
- **Database Seeding**: Comprehensive seed script for development environment setup

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> PublicSite
    PublicSite --> Authentication: User Action
    Authentication --> AdminDashboard: Admin Login
    Authentication --> ClientPortal: Client Login
    AdminDashboard --> ManageContent
    AdminDashboard --> ManageMessages
    AdminDashboard --> ManageApplications
    AdminDashboard --> ManageQuotes
    ClientPortal --> ViewProfile
    ClientPortal --> UpdateProfile
    ManageContent --> UpdateHero
    ManageContent --> UpdateServices
    ManageContent --> UpdatePricing
    ManageContent --> UpdateTeam
    ManageMessages --> ViewMessages
    ManageMessages --> RespondToMessage
    ManageApplications --> ReviewApplications
    ManageApplications --> UpdateStatus
    ManageQuotes --> ReviewQuotes
    ManageQuotes --> UpdateStatus
    PublicSite --> SubmitContact
    PublicSite --> RequestQuote
    PublicSite --> ApplyForJob
```

Sources:
- [package.json](package.json)
- [next.config.ts](next.config.ts)
- [prisma/seed.ts](prisma/seed.ts)
- [src/lib/db.ts](src/lib/db.ts)
- [src/lib/prisma.ts](src/lib/prisma.ts)
</blog>
